body_html:
Some searching has found this page http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17443976/how-to-allow-z-multidefs-with-g47, but i'm unsure how to proceed to make this build for me. currently grepping for zmuldefs to hopefully replace it.

Deleting the option entirely leads to this error further down about not finding omp d: library not found for -lgomp

After some playing around I replaced the only instance of "-lgomp" with "-L/some/path/libiomp5.dylib", turns out I had the library from matlab. Not sure how advised that is, but going to try carry on with the build as this eliminated the -lgomp error.

well it seemed to build the wheel and install that through pip fine, and run some training on gpu.
body_text:
Some searching has found this page http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17443976/how-to-allow-z-multidefs-with-g47, but i'm unsure how to proceed to make this build for me. currently grepping for zmuldefs to hopefully replace it.
Deleting the option entirely leads to this error further down about not finding omp d: library not found for -lgomp
After some playing around I replaced the only instance of "-lgomp" with "-L/some/path/libiomp5.dylib", turns out I had the library from matlab. Not sure how advised that is, but going to try carry on with the build as this eliminated the -lgomp error.
well it seemed to build the wheel and install that through pip fine, and run some training on gpu.
body:
Some searching has found this page http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17443976/how-to-allow-z-multidefs-with-g47, but i'm unsure how to proceed to make this build for me. currently grepping for zmuldefs to hopefully replace it.

Deleting the option entirely leads to this error further down about not finding omp `d: library not found for -lgomp`

After some playing around I replaced the only instance of "-lgomp" with "-L/some/path/libiomp5.dylib", turns out I had the library from matlab. Not sure how advised that is, but going to try carry on with the build as this eliminated the -lgomp error.

well it seemed to build the wheel and install that through pip fine, and run some training on gpu.
